trans-unit.source: Many Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) features require the use of buffers, which are expensive to create and destroy.
You can use the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager"></xref> class to manage a buffer pool.
The pool and its buffers are created when you instantiate this class and destroyed when the buffer pool is reclaimed by garbage collection.
Every time you need to use a buffer, you take one from the pool, use it, and return it to the pool when done.
This process is much faster than creating and destroying a buffer every time you need to use one.
This class is commonly used while implementing custom encoders or custom transport channels.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager"></xref> class.
Because this constructor is `protected`, you can only call it from a derived class.
Releases the buffers currently cached in the manager.
Creates a new BufferManager with a specified maximum buffer pool size and a maximum size for each individual buffer in the pool.
This method creates a new buffer pool with as many buffers as can be created.
The maximum size of the pool.
The maximum size of an individual buffer.
Returns a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager"></xref> object with the specified parameters.

In the [.NET for Windows Store apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=247912) or the [Portable Class Library](~/docs/standard/cross-platform/cross-platform-development-with-the-portable-class-library.md), catch the base class exception, <xref href="System.OutOfMemoryException"></xref>, instead.
There was insufficient memory to create the requested buffer pool.
maxBufferPoolSize or maxBufferSize was less than zero.
Returns a buffer to the pool.
The buffer is returned to the pool and is available for re-use.
A reference to the buffer being returned.
buffer reference cannot be `null`.
Length of buffer does not match the pool's buffer length property.
Gets a buffer of at least the specified size from the pool.
If successful, the system returns a byte array buffer of at least the requested size.
The size, in bytes, of the requested buffer.
A byte array that is the requested size of the buffer.
bufferSize cannot be less than zero.
